response.original_title: Snake Island: The Volcanic Life of Sea Kraits
response.overview: On the reefs of Pulau Manuk in Indonesia’s Banda Arc, sea kraits thrive among coral rooted in a volcanic island rising from deep ocean. As their daily rhythms unfold, a rare behaviour emerges. Sea kraits hunt in groups alongside schools of bluefin trevally, forming one of the ocean’s most elusive predator alliances.
response.title: Snake Island: The Volcanic Life of Sea Kraits
